FuncDef:
The aaa-author session-timeout invalid-value enable command prevents a device from disconnecting or reauthenticating users when the RADIUS server delivers session-timeout with value 0.
The undo aaa-author session-timeout invalid-value enable command restores the default setting. The aaa-author session-timeout invalid-value enable command prevents a device from disconnecting or reauthenticating users when the RADIUS server delivers session-timeout with value 0. The undo aaa-author session-timeout invalid-value enable command restores the default setting. By default, when the RADIUS server delivers session-timeout with value 0, this attribute does not take effect. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
